page.title: 19 ASKERN SPA
page.content: During the {18th}century, Askern became famous as a {spa town}.Natural springs brought water into the lake and lakeside area. This water was by all accounts, very smelly. It contained a good deal of sulphur, but it was supposed to be good for the health. Bath houses were built around the lake so that people could take the waters and Doctors often prescribed a drink of the water as a care for chest complaints. A special railway line was laid to bring vistors to Askern and miners from surrounding pit villages were sent to Askern to recuperate.At one time Askern was thought to rival Harrogate or Bath as a spa town but with the sinking of the coal mine in { {1911},industry took over,and the spa died a natural death.
